ygData.subject: Re: Resisting spells and fizzles?
ygData.msgSnippet: I read once from verrant that a wisdom influence fizzles, better to say if a spell fizzle in base of other factors there is also a small chance based on wisdom
ygData.messageBody:
I read once from verrant that a wisdom influence fizzles, better to say if
a spell fizzle in base of other factors there is also a small chance based
on wisdom that it will continue casting.

But did wisdom also influence resistance this is what im interesed in. This
can try somone who have many wisdom magic items so he can say diference
when he put up his wisdom for 5 or 10 points and when be boost his
inteligence for 5 or 10 points.

Also one another interesting thing what i have seen is that when i cast
root on yellow monster in middle of fight when many fighters bash it, it
nearly immediatly break spell. But if i do a same thing on a blue MOB if
lasts long time.

If monster is not hit it normaly lasts a same amount of time on blue and
yellow MOB.

Recently a spell department man in verant says that there is a chance to
break a spell with each hit it looks like this is a same percentual as is
used to save against spell so a root casted bu low lv rooter will not hold
thrue many hits but a root by higer lv caster will stay on for more hit saves.








At 20.44 26/04/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: "Dennis Chan" <dchan17@...>
>
>my guess is wisdom...heard about this on enchanter board as well.
>
>

>>From: Wizard <wizard@...>
>>
>>I play a high elf wizard and i was gruped with a human wizard, we were both
>>13 lv and i see that he fizzles much much more and many times his spells
>>are resisted? we are same lv and class only race is diferent we both have
>>our skills maxed from chanaling to evocation and so on.
>>
>>maybe our stats affect the spells resistance i thing that wisdom can be
>>very important factor in this? or it is dexterity?
>>
>>Anyone other have a similar experience?
>>
